jobDescription: Data Analyst, MetadataDEPARTMENT: Enterprise Metadata ManagementSTATUS: Full time/Regular/ExemptThe Data Analyst for Metadata is a key role on a small team which performs a wide range of activities supporting the PBS enterprise metadata management initiative, including the development and maintenance of the PBS Enterprise Metadata Model and the implementation of a metadata stewardship program, in support of semantic interoperability across the PBS eco-system. S/he will work directly with the Metadata Architect and key technical staff and act as a liaison between the Enterprise Metadata team, Technology & Operations, metadata stewards and other key business stakeholders.Essential duties will include, but are not limited to:Support the implementation of PBS metadata management, including the development, maintenance and documentation of the enterprise metadata model, schema, taxonomy/vocabulary and related best practice and stewardship.Act as a facilitator within all phases of the metadata management lifecycle to document business requirements and help align objectives and policies.Lead the design, creation and maintenance of relevant metadata and identifier mappings and crosswalks and related data storesSupport for the onboarding of business units into the stewardship program.Helping streamline the data supply chain, including facilitating legacy application and data migration activities to enable the metadata standard across the ecosystem.Catalog existing data sources, enable access to internal and external data, and work with open datasets, including populating and extracting data from internal and public open sets as appropriate.Support data quality and standardization activities.Design reporting dashboards and visualization to translate data to an understandable illustrative format and fulfill ad hoc reporting requests.Assist with initial data exploration steps (binning, pivoting, summarizing and finding correlations, for example) and suggest analytics opportunities and best practices.Support the use of statistical models to identify and reveal trends, patterns, and relationships in data to provide guidance for Senior Leadership decision making processes.Requirements for success:
